## Viewing first data

```{r, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(readr)


bety_src <- src_postgres(dbname = "bety", 
                         password = 'bety', 
                         host = 'terra-bety.default', 
                         user = 'bety', 
                         port = 5432)

traits <- tbl(bety_src, 'traits')

variables <- tbl(bety_src, 'variables') %>%
  mutate(variable_id = id)

sites <- tbl(bety_src, 'sites') %>%
  mutate(site_id = id)

big_table <- traits %>%
  left_join(variables, by = 'variable_id') %>% 
  left_join(sites, by = 'site_id')


# getting a list geom_traits of traits we want, which are actually there

checkme <- c('canopy_height',
'chi_leaf',
'height',
'leaf_attachment_angle',
'leaf_length',
'leaf_node_count',
'leaf_width',
'plant_height',
'stem_diameter')

geom_traits <- c()

for(tname in checkme){
my_trait <- big_table %>% 
  select(sitename, name, mean) %>% 
  filter(name == tname) %>% 
  collect(n=Inf)
if(dim(my_trait) > 0){ geom_traits[[length(geom_traits)+1]] <- tname }
}


# download traits we want to /data/*.csv

for(tname in geom_traits){
  big_table %>%
    filter(name == tname) %>%
    select(name,date,mean,sitename,greenhouse,city,cultivar_id,site_id) %>% 
    collect(n = Inf) %>% 
    write_csv(path = paste0("./data/",tname,".csv"))
}




big_table %>%
  filter(name == 'plant_height') %>%
  collect(n=Inf) %>%
  dim()



```
